cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba and 300 mi SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move northwest, cross or brush the northern Yucatan late Monday, enter the southern Gulf Tuesday, then accelerate north-northeast toward the central Gulf Coast mid-week before sweeping inland across the southeastern U.S. toward the Mid-Atlantic late week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch/Warning from Tulum to Rio Lagartos, Mexico; Tropical-Storm Warning Pinar del Rio, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Tulum–Rio Lagartos (incl. Cozumel); Tropical-Storm Warning Pinar del Rio, Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle expected to receive strongest winds and surge, with inland track across Alabama, Georgia, and the southern Appalachians.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current guidance suggests 1–3 inches in Mid-Atlantic)
weather_observation.wind: Remnant system may bring gusty winds (20–35 kt) late Thu–Fri but tropical-storm force winds are unlikely (<10% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Chesapeake Bay given inland, post-landfall track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 1–3 inches of rain late Thu–Fri that could produce localized urban/stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief heavy rain bands may reduce visibility and temporarily halt cargo handling; isolated thunderstorms possible.
